APIKeySecurityScheme.description: Defines a security scheme using an API key.

description.description: An optional description for the security scheme.

location.description: The location of the API key. Valid values are "query", "header", or "cookie".

name.description: The name of the header, query, or cookie parameter to be used.

APIKeySecurityScheme.title: API Key Security Scheme

AgentCapabilities.description: Defines optional capabilities supported by an agent.

extensions.description: A list of protocol extensions supported by the agent.

pushNotifications.description: Indicates if the agent supports sending push notifications for asynchronous task updates.

stateTransitionHistory.description: Indicates if the agent provides a history of state transitions for a task.

streaming.description: Indicates if the agent supports streaming responses.

AgentCapabilities.title: Agent Capabilities

AgentExtension.description: A declaration of a protocol extension supported by an Agent.

description.description: A human-readable description of how this agent uses the extension.

required.description: If true, the client must understand and comply with the extension's requirements.

uri.description: The unique URI identifying the extension.

AgentExtension.title: Agent Extension

AgentCard.description:
AgentCard is a self-describing manifest for an agent. It provides essential
 metadata including the agent's identity, capabilities, skills, supported
 communication methods, and security requirements.
 Next ID: 20

capabilities.description: A2A Capability set supported by the agent.

defaultInputModes.description:
protolint:enable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 The set of interaction modes that the agent supports across all skills.
 This can be overridden per skill. Defined as media types.

defaultOutputModes.description: The media types supported as outputs from this agent.

description.description:
A human-readable description of the agent, assisting users and other agents
 in understanding its purpose.
 Example: "Agent that helps users with recipes and cooking."

documentationUrl.description: A url to provide additional documentation about the agent.

iconUrl.description: An optional URL to an icon for the agent.

name.description:
A human readable name for the agent.
 Example: "Recipe Agent"

protocolVersion.description:
The version of the A2A protocol this agent supports.
 Default: "1.0"

provider.description: The service provider of the agent.

security.description:
protolint:disable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 Security requirements for contacting the agent.

securitySchemes.description: The security scheme details used for authenticating with this agent.

signatures.description: JSON Web Signatures computed for this AgentCard.

skills.description:
Skills represent an ability of an agent. It is largely
 a descriptive concept but represents a more focused set of behaviors that the
 agent is likely to succeed at.

supportedInterfaces.description: Ordered list of supported interfaces. First entry is preferred.

supportsExtendedAgentCard.description: Whether the agent supports providing an extended agent card when authenticated.

version.description:
The version of the agent.
 Example: "1.0.0"

AgentCard.title: Agent Card

AgentCardSignature.description:
AgentCardSignature represents a JWS signature of an AgentCard.
 This follows the JSON format of an RFC 7515 JSON Web Signature (JWS).

protected.description:
The protected JWS header for the signature. This is always a
 base64url-encoded JSON object. Required.

AgentCardSignature.title: Agent Card Signature

AgentInterface.description:
Declares a combination of a target URL and a transport protocol for interacting with the agent.
 This allows agents to expose the same functionality over multiple protocol binding mechanisms.

protocolBinding.description:
The protocol binding supported at this URL. This is an open form string, to be
 easily extended for other protocol bindings. The core ones officially
 supported are `JSONRPC`, `GRPC` and `HTTP+JSON`.

tenant.description: Tenant to be set in the request when calling the agent.

url.description:
The URL where this interface is available. Must be a valid absolute HTTPS URL in production.
 Example: "https://api.example.com/a2a/v1", "https://grpc.example.com/a2a"

AgentInterface.title: Agent Interface

AgentProvider.description: Represents the service provider of an agent.

organization.description:
The name of the agent provider's organization.
 Example: "Google"

url.description:
A URL for the agent provider's website or relevant documentation.
 Example: "https://ai.google.dev"

AgentProvider.title: Agent Provider

AgentSkill.description: Represents a distinct capability or function that an agent can perform.

description.description: A detailed description of the skill.

examples.description: Example prompts or scenarios that this skill can handle.

id.description: A unique identifier for the agent's skill.

inputModes.description: The set of supported input media types for this skill, overriding the agent's defaults.

name.description: A human-readable name for the skill.

outputModes.description: The set of supported output media types for this skill, overriding the agent's defaults.

security.description:
protolint:disable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 Security schemes necessary for this skill.

tags.description: A set of keywords describing the skill's capabilities.

AgentSkill.title: Agent Skill

AuthorizationCodeOAuthFlow.description: Defines configuration details for the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow.

authorizationUrl.description: The authorization URL to be used for this flow.

refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens.

scopes.description: The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme.

tokenUrl.description: The token URL to be used for this flow.

AuthorizationCodeOAuthFlow.title: Authorization CodeO Auth Flow

ClientCredentialsOAuthFlow.description: Defines configuration details for the OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials flow.

refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens.

scopes.description: The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme.

tokenUrl.description: The token URL to be used for this flow.

ClientCredentialsOAuthFlow.title: Client CredentialsO Auth Flow

HTTPAuthSecurityScheme.description: Defines a security scheme using HTTP authentication.

bearerFormat.description:
A hint to the client to identify how the bearer token is formatted (e.g., "JWT").
 This is primarily for documentation purposes.

description.description: An optional description for the security scheme.

scheme.description:
The name of the HTTP Authentication scheme to be used in the Authorization header,
 as defined in RFC7235 (e.g., "Bearer").
 This value should be registered in the IANA Authentication Scheme registry.

HTTPAuthSecurityScheme.title: HTTP Auth Security Scheme

ImplicitOAuthFlow.description: Defines configuration details for the OAuth 2.0 Implicit flow.

authorizationUrl.description: The authorization URL to be used for this flow.

refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens.

scopes.description: The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme.

ImplicitOAuthFlow.title: ImplicitO Auth Flow

MutualTlsSecurityScheme.description: Defines a security scheme using mTLS authentication.

description.description: An optional description for the security scheme.

MutualTlsSecurityScheme.title: Mutual Tls Security Scheme

OAuth2SecurityScheme.description: Defines a security scheme using OAuth 2.0.

description.description: An optional description for the security scheme.

flows.description: An object containing configuration information for the supported OAuth 2.0 flows.

oauth2MetadataUrl.description:
URL to the oauth2 authorization server metadata
 RFC8414 (https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8414). TLS is required.

OAuth2SecurityScheme.title: O Auth2 Security Scheme

OAuthFlows.description: Defines the configuration for the supported OAuth 2.0 flows.

authorizationCode.description: Configuration for the OAuth Authorization Code flow.

clientCredentials.description: Configuration for the OAuth Client Credentials flow.

implicit.description: Configuration for the OAuth Implicit flow.

password.description: Configuration for the OAuth Resource Owner Password flow.

OAuthFlows.title: O Auth Flows

OpenIdConnectSecurityScheme.description: Defines a security scheme using OpenID Connect.

description.description: An optional description for the security scheme.

openIdConnectUrl.description:
The OpenID Connect Discovery URL for the OIDC provider's metadata.
 See: https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-discovery-1_0.html

OpenIdConnectSecurityScheme.title: Open Id Connect Security Scheme

PasswordOAuthFlow.description: Defines configuration details for the OAuth 2.0 Resource Owner Password flow.

refreshUrl.description: The URL to be used for obtaining refresh tokens.

scopes.description: The available scopes for the OAuth2 security scheme.

tokenUrl.description: The token URL to be used for this flow.

PasswordOAuthFlow.title: PasswordO Auth Flow

SecurityScheme.description:
Defines a security scheme that can be used to secure an agent's endpoints.
 This is a discriminated union type based on the OpenAPI 3.2 Security Scheme Object.
 See: https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.2.0.html#security-scheme-object
SecurityScheme.title: Security Scheme

artifactId.description:
Unique identifier (e.g. UUID) for the artifact. It must be at least unique
 within a task.

description.description: A human readable description of the artifact, optional.

extensions.description: The URIs of extensions that are present or contributed to this Artifact.

metadata.description: Optional metadata included with the artifact.

name.description: A human readable name for the artifact.

parts.description: The content of the artifact. Must contain at least one part.

data.description: A JSON object containing arbitrary data.

FilePart.description:
FilePart represents the different ways files can be provided. If files are
 small, directly feeding the bytes is supported via file_with_bytes. If the
 file is large, the agent should read the content as appropriate directly
 from the file_with_uri source.

fileWithBytes.description: The base64-encoded content of the file.

fileWithUri.description: A URL pointing to the file's content.

mediaType.description: The media type of the file (e.g., "application/pdf").

name.description: An optional name for the file (e.g., "document.pdf").

FilePart.title: File Part

Part.description:
Part represents a container for a section of communication content.
 Parts can be purely textual, some sort of file (image, video, etc) or
 a structured data blob (i.e. JSON).

file.description: The file content, represented as either a URI or as base64-encoded bytes.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with this part.

text.description: The string content of the text part.

Part.title: Part

AuthenticationInfo.description: Defines authentication details, used for push notifications.

schemes.description: A list of supported authentication schemes (e.g., 'Basic', 'Bearer').

AuthenticationInfo.title: Authentication Info

CancelTaskRequest.description: Represents a request for the `tasks/cancel` method.

name.description:
The resource name of the task to cancel.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

CancelTaskRequest.title: Cancel Task Request

DeleteTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.description: Represents a request for the `tasks/pushNotificationConfig/delete` method.

name.description:
The resource name of the config to delete.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}/pushNotificationConfigs/{config_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

DeleteTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.title: Delete Task Push Notification Config Request

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

name.description:
The resource name of the config to retrieve.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}/pushNotificationConfigs/{config_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

GetTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.title: Get Task Push Notification Config Request

GetTaskRequest.description: Represents a request for the `tasks/get` method.

historyLength.description: The maximum number of messages to include in the history.

name.description:
The resource name of the task.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

GetTaskRequest.title: Get Task Request

pageSize.description: The maximum number of configurations to return.

pageToken.description: A page token received from a previous ListTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest call.

parent.description:
The parent task resource.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

ListTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.title: List Task Push Notification Config Request

ListTaskPushNotificationConfigResponse.description:
Represents a successful response for the `tasks/pushNotificationConfig/list`
 method.

configs.description: The list of push notification configurations.

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
 If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

ListTaskPushNotificationConfigResponse.title: List Task Push Notification Config Response

PushNotificationConfig.description: Configuration for setting up push notifications for task updates.

authentication.description: Information about the authentication to sent with the notification

id.description: A unique identifier (e.g. UUID) for this push notification.

url.description: Url to send the notification too

PushNotificationConfig.title: Push Notification Config

TaskPushNotificationConfig.description:
A container associating a push notification configuration with a specific
 task.

name.description:
The resource name of the config.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}/pushNotificationConfigs/{config_id}

TaskPushNotificationConfig.title: Task Push Notification Config

ListTasksRequest.description: Parameters for listing tasks with optional filtering criteria.

contextId.description: Filter tasks by context ID to get tasks from a specific conversation or session.

historyLength.description: The maximum number of messages to include in each task's history.

includeArtifacts.description:
Whether to include artifacts in the returned tasks.
 Defaults to false to reduce payload size.

lastUpdatedAfter.description:
Filter tasks updated after this timestamp (milliseconds since epoch).
 Only tasks with a last updated time greater than or equal to this value will be returned.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of tasks to return. Must be between 1 and 100.
 Defaults to 50 if not specified.

pageToken.description: Token for pagination. Use the next_page_token from a previous ListTasksResponse.

status.description: Filter tasks by their current status state.
status.title: Task State

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

ListTasksRequest.title: List Tasks Request

ListTasksResponse.description: Result object for tasks/list method containing an array of tasks and pagination information.

nextPageToken.description: Token for retrieving the next page. Empty string if no more results.

tasks.description: Array of tasks matching the specified criteria.

totalSize.description: Total number of tasks available (before pagination).

ListTasksResponse.title: List Tasks Response

Message.description:
Message is one unit of communication between client and server. It is
 associated with a context and optionally a task. Since the server is
 responsible for the context definition, it must always provide a context_id
 in its messages. The client can optionally provide the context_id if it
 knows the context to associate the message to. Similarly for task_id,
 except the server decides if a task is created and whether to include the
 task_id.

contextId.description:
The context id of the message. This is optional and if set, the message
 will be associated with the given context.

extensions.description: The URIs of extensions that are present or contributed to this Message.

messageId.description:
The unique identifier (e.g. UUID) of the message. This is required and
 created by the message creator.

metadata.description:
protolint:enable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 Any optional metadata to provide along with the message.

parts.description:
protolint:disable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 Parts is the container of the message content.

referenceTaskIds.description: A list of task IDs that this message references for additional context.

role.description: Identifies the sender of the message.
role.title: Role

taskId.description:
The task id of the message. This is optional and if set, the message
 will be associated with the given task.

Message.title: Message

Task.description:
Task is the core unit of action for A2A. It has a current status
 and when results are created for the task they are stored in the
 artifact. If there are multiple turns for a task, these are stored in
 history.

artifacts.description: A set of output artifacts for a Task.

contextId.description:
Unique identifier (e.g. UUID) for the contextual collection of interactions
 (tasks and messages). Created by the A2A server.

history.description:
protolint:disable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 The history of interactions from a task.

id.description:
Unique identifier (e.g. UUID) for the task, generated by the server for a
 new task.

metadata.description:
protolint:enable REPEATED_FIELD_NAMES_PLURALIZED
 A key/value object to store custom metadata about a task.

status.description: The current status of a Task, including state and a message.

Task.title: Task

TaskStatus.description: A container for the status of a task

message.description: A message associated with the status.

state.description: The current state of this task.
state.title: Task State

timestamp.description:
ISO 8601 Timestamp when the status was recorded.
 Example: "2023-10-27T10:00:00Z"

TaskStatus.title: Task Status

SendMessageConfiguration.description: Configuration of a send message request.

acceptedOutputModes.description: A list of media types the client is prepared to accept for response parts. Agents SHOULD use this to tailor their output.

blocking.description: If true, the operation waits until the task reaches a terminal state before returning. Default is false.

historyLength.description: The maximum number of messages to include in the history.

pushNotificationConfig.description: Configuration for the agent to send push notifications for task updates.

SendMessageConfiguration.title: Send Message Configuration

SendMessageRequest.description:
/////////// Request Messages ///////////
 Represents a request for the `message/send` method.

message.description: The message to send to the agent.

metadata.description: A flexible key-value map for passing additional context or parameters.

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

SendMessageRequest.title: Send Message Request

SetTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.description: Represents a request for the `tasks/pushNotificationConfig/set` method.

configId.description: The ID for the new config.

parent.description:
The parent task resource for this config.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.

SetTaskPushNotificationConfigRequest.title: Set Task Push Notification Config Request

StreamResponse.description: A wrapper object used in streaming operations to encapsulate different types of response data.

artifactUpdate.description: An event indicating a task artifact update.

message.description: A Message object containing a message from the agent.

statusUpdate.description: An event indicating a task status update.

task.description: A Task object containing the current state of the task.

StreamResponse.title: Stream Response

TaskArtifactUpdateEvent.description:
TaskArtifactUpdateEvent represents a task delta where an artifact has
 been generated.

append.description:
If true, the content of this artifact should be appended to a previously
 sent artifact with the same ID.

artifact.description: The artifact that was generated or updated.

contextId.description: The id of the context that this task belongs to.

lastChunk.description: If true, this is the final chunk of the artifact.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the artifact update.

taskId.description: The id of the task for this artifact.

TaskArtifactUpdateEvent.title: Task Artifact Update Event

TaskStatusUpdateEvent.description:
An event sent by the agent to notify the client of a change in a task's
 status.

contextId.description: The id of the context that the task belongs to

final.description: If true, this is the final event in the stream for this interaction.

metadata.description: Optional metadata to associate with the task update.

status.description: The new status of the task.

taskId.description: The id of the task that is changed

TaskStatusUpdateEvent.title: Task Status Update Event

name.description:
The resource name of the task to subscribe to.
 Format: tasks/{task_id}

tenant.description: Optional tenant, provided as a path parameter.
